## Declare Array and Assigning Values

``` bash
arr[index]=value
```

``` {bash}
arr[0]='a'
arr[1]='b'
echo ${arr[1]}
## b
```

## Initializing during declaration

Two options:

``` bash
declare -a arr=(el1 el2)
arr=(el1 el2)
```

``` {bash}
arr=('a' 'b')
echo ${arr[1]}
## b
```

## Print all elements 

``` {bash}
echo ${arr[@]}
## a b
```

## Read a File into an Array 

``` {bash}
arr=(`cat ./data/bash_sample_csv.csv`)
echo ${arr[@]}
## col1,col2 row11,row12 row21,row22
```

## Loop over array

``` {bash}
arr=('a' 'b')
for el in "${arr[@]}"; do 
  echo $el
done
## a
## b
```

## Loop over a space separated string

``` {bash}
str="a b"
for el in $str; do 
  echo $el
done
## a 
## b
```
